concept.title: Cassandra
concept.shortdesc: The Cassandra destination writes data to a Cassandra cluster.

conbody.p: Cassandra destinationoverviewdestinationsCassandraWhen you configure the Cassandra destination, you define connection information, optional user credentials, and map incoming fields to columns in the Cassandra table.

Batches written to Cassandra are atomic - you can only write entire batches of records to Cassandra. If an error occurs with one or more records in a batch, Cassandra fails the entire batch. When a batch fails, all records are sent to the stage for error handling. Due to Cassandra requirements, the data types of the incoming fields must match the data types of the corresponding Cassandra columns. When appropriate, use a Type Converter processor earlier in the pipeline to convert data types.
